questions.text: What is the minimum retention period for design and development records under the EU MDR?

options.explanation: 5 years is too short for design records under EU MDR.
10 years is used for audit records but not design records.
EU MDR Art. 10(8) requires retention for the lifetime of the device plus 15 years.
Records have defined retention periods and can be disposed after that period.

questions.text: Who is responsible for approving the disposition of quality records?

options.explanation: The author creates the record but does not authorize disposition.
Per Section 5.6, the Quality Manager approves disposition of records.
Disposition requires Quality Manager approval specifically.
IT manages storage systems but does not authorize disposition.

questions.text: Electronic records in the QMS platform can be modified after creation to correct errors.
questions.explanation: Electronic records are immutable once created to maintain integrity and compliance with Part 11 requirements.

questions.text: How often does Quality review records approaching end of retention period?

options.explanation: The review cycle is quarterly, not monthly.
Per Section 5.6, Quality reviews records approaching end of retention period quarterly.
Annual reviews may miss records approaching their retention limit.
Reviews are conducted on a scheduled basis, not on demand.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a required element for quality record identification?

options.explanation: Unique identifier is required per Section 5.1.
Date of creation is required per Section 5.1.
File size is not a required identification element. Required elements are: unique identifier, date, author, and status.
